status_notes: Case Closed. Case Noted. In 2009 The Public Works Department put out a RFP to have a private entity clean, make safe, improve and lease the pwd land under Rte. 1A (Porter and Chelsea St). Granite Castle Inc. was the only respondent to the RFP. In 2010 the commissioner of PWD and Granite Castle Inc. signed a five year lease with a five year renewable extension. . Granite Castle Inc. is responsible to make improvement to the lot at their own expense, and is required to make space available to the public in a declared snow emergency.
description: Details: the other day I was walking on the intersection between Chelsea street and porter street. Once I cross the street on under the bridge (McClellan Highway) and I notice signs of private parking for Santarpios restaurant only. I did some research at BRA maps and it shows as a city of Boston property (public), and I do not think is fear to us as residents to be subject to not be able to use public parking spaces, just because a private owner decided to use the lot parcel id 0103712000.Tere is any agreement with the city and santarpios? are the residents getting any benefit from it? the city just spend a lot of money fixing that space from tax payers to be handle and occupied to a single company, I would like to know exactly how the city is handling this. Thanks

status_notes: Case Closed. Case Noted. The Boston Transportation Department has dedicated personnel assigned to the Fenway neighborhood during Red Sox home games (excluding Sundays & Holidays). So far this season 6,089 tickets have been issued to illegally parked vehicles in the residential areas surrounding Fenway Park. Any changes to the regulations and/or fines would need to be approved by the Boston City Council. BTD will continue to closely monitor and enforce all parking regulations throughout the baseball season.

description: The closest intersecting street: Beacon St & Stone Ave/ House R | How is the car parked illegally? Other | Details: I commute to Boston College on bike and everyday cars park illegally in the bike lane on Beacon St near House Rd outbound and between Stone Ave and Acacia Ave inbound. This is very dangerous to myself and other riders because we are forced into the traffic lane where the road narrows near BC and during rush hour this is very frightening. Also, heading outbound there are significant potholes in the road which are extremely hard to see in low light when suddenly pushed into the main flow of traffic due to illegibly parked cars. I have noticed this problem since the Fall, but assumed there must have been some sort of exception to the clearly posted "Tow Zone" signs, but I recently checked and find no exceptions. I phoned the Boston Police today who told me to call 911 and report, however, not wanting to clog up the line with non-emergency, I phoned BC police, who recommended I contact this department. I also emailed the bike contact for the city who referred me to the police. I appreciate your help very much as Boston is a very stressful place to bike, though it's getting better! The bike lanes are helpful (though they are in the "door" zone of parked cars) and when cars do not respect them it puts both bikers and motorists at risk for accidents. Lastly, this is all occurring on the Boston side of the town line which runs through BC. I appreciate your help in the matter very much. | Type of vehicle: Car | Make: Other | Model: Unknown | Color: Unknown

status_notes: Case Closed. Case Noted. Officers have been instructed to enforce all bike lane violations. Will monitor this location closely.
description: The closest intersecting street: Bike Lanes on Columbus Ave | How is the car parked illegally? Other | Details: . To Whom It May Concern: .. I am writing to put you on notice that the marked bike lanes along both sides of Columbus Avenue between the Ruggles T stop and Dartmouth Street are currently blocked by numerous parked vehicles. I am writing to request that you rectify this dangerous situation for bike commuters and riders and ensure a safe and functioning bike lane along that stretch of Columbus Ave. ... It does not appear that the Boston Transportation Department is currently ticketing these illegally parked vehicles. In many instances there are cars and trucks (including commercial vehicles) completely straddling and blocking the bike lane and even partially blocking the adjacent car lane. Of course this situation forces those of us riding our bikes on Columbus Ave to ride in the middle of the single remaining car lane thereby creating a dangerous and frustrating situation for both bike riders and cars traveling along Columbus Ave. ... I understand there is still a fair amount of snow and ice along the curb in this area such that it might be difficult for vehicles parking on Columbus to completely avoid the bike lane. However, it is now March and significant amounts of snow and ice have melted. It has also been a long time since the last major snowstorm. Given the City's concerted efforts to improve the Boston's reputation for bike accessibility and bike safety, I would think the City would not tolerate this flagrant disregard for parking regulations and dangerous situation for bike commuters and riders. My view of the cars parking in that area is that if you give them an inch they will take a mile! Don't you think it is time to start ticketing these illegally parked vehicles or take some other action to ensure clear and safe bike lanes? .. Please respond and let me know if there is anything you can do to address this dangerous situation. .. Thank you kindly for your anticipated response. .. Sincerely, Dan Morse . | Type of vehicle: Car | Details: Cars, trucks, and commercial vehicles parked on both sides of Columbus Ave. between the Ruggles T Stop and Dartmouth St. | Vehicle License Plate State: MA

description: The closest intersecting street: Ormond st | How is the car parked illegally? Other | Details: The even-numbered side of this part of Wellington St is a no-parking zone. There is a car parked on that side a couple houses north of Ormond St. It has been there since before the first of the January blizzards, and is now mostly buried in snow and ice. Year-round, I frequently see other cars parked on that side when taking my kids to & from the Young Achievers School. That street is very narrow, is used by schoolbuses and garbage trucks, and is very busy during YA's drop-off and dismissal times (including before & after school). Now, with so much snow on both sides of the street, and people parking poorly and/or illegally because of it, it can be *extremely* difficult to pass another car. Parking officers need to monitor this street more regularly, and enforce the parking rules here. (Also, the intersection of Wellington Hill St & Blue Hill Ave needs to be plowed more thoroughly. description: The closest intersecting street: Surface Road | How is the car parked illegally? Other | Details: I work in the Financial District and would like to complain about autos/trucks driving on sidewalks and illegal parking. This is taking place behind The Times restaurant and bar off Broad St next to the Greeway and the Surface Road. Although Massport put up no parking signs and fenced off the area to deter parking, the fences have been taken down and the flower planters have been moved to allow parking by staff and contractors even though they are 20 feet from an operating parking lot. Most serious is that cars and delivery vans and contractors trucks routinely drive right down the middle of the sidewalk to access this no parking area. I walk that sidewalk everyday and overlook the the area from my office and routinely see pedestrians get out of the way of trucks and autos heading right down the middle of the sidewalk. Yesterday I saw a Mercedes-Benz drive the length of the sidelwalk from India Street to pick up a person at the back door of The Times. They continued down the sidewalk and reentered the street at Broad St. Today a delivery van drives down the sidewalk to deliver to the back door of The Times - mostly blocking the sidewalk. This is not a road, this is not a parking lot! Can you please stop this before someone gets hurt. Thank you Alan Hass | Details: various cars and trucks all day long

status_notes: Case Closed. Case Resolved. CONSIDERATION IS GIVEN TO ALL CHURCHES.
description: The closest intersecting street: W. Brookline St. | How is the car parked illegally? Double parked | Details: I live at 411 Shawmut Ave—right across from Blackstone Square and sandwiched between the Salvation Army Harbor Light Center and St. Stephen’s Episcopal Church. We’ve been here for well over a year now, and we continue to have problems with St. Stephen’s church and their parishioners’ parking. Every Saturday morning, for hours and hours, church-goers double park their vehicles on Shawmut Ave, blocking in residents’ cars. I’ve attached some pictures to give you an idea. We’ve tried the obvious neighborly things to do. We spoke with Vicar Tim Crellin at the church, and that was a dead end. Because the church is rented to an Ethiopian Orthodox congregation on Saturday’s, he took no responsibility and made it clear that it was not his problem. Although Saturday tends to be worse than Sunday, this doesn’t address the problem with his own congregation on Sunday. We also tried to talk with the Ethiopian Orthodox congregation leaders, and they insist they have a standing permit to double park. They said if we need our vehicle, we should ask the ushers to disturb the Mass to have people move their cars. That’s obviously inconvenient for us and for them. So, several months ago, when we were parked in (again), we contacted the Mayor’s hotline. We managed to get BTD out here on a Saturday, but they wouldn’t tow vehicles. Instead, they asked the church-goers to move them. Fortunately, they did, but as soon as the BTD left, the cars returned. So, tt continues to happen every Saturday...and it's getting worse. We’re at our wits end with handling this. We have made it a point never to park on that section of the street on a weekend for fear of being blocked in. Is there anything that can be done to enforce the parking rules and eliminate this problem? | Type of vehicle: Other | Make: Unknown | Model: Unknown | Color: Unknown
